description:
I can not get tenant quota from /{version}/{tenantID}/os-quota-sets
However, I can get it from /{version}/{tenantID}/os-quota-sets/{tenantID}.
title: Can not get tenant quota from /{version}/{tenantID}/os-quota-sets

comments.content:
I can not get tenant quota from /{version}/{tenantID}/os-quota-sets
However, I can get it from /{version}/{tenantID}/os-quota-sets/{tenantID}.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~nati-ueno

comments.content: The extension isn't designed to support /{version}/{tenantID}/os-quota-sets.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~bcwaldon

comments.content:
Hi Brian

Even if so, this spec looks a little bit redundant.
Why this API get same value parameter twice times?

2011/12/2 Brian Waldon <email address hidden>:
> The extension isn't designed to support /{version}/{tenantID}/os-quota-
> sets.
>
> ** Changed in: nova
>       Status: New => Invalid
>
> --
> You received this bug notification because you are subscribed to the bug
> report.
> https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/899298
>
> Title:
>  Can not get tenant quota from /{version}/{tenantID}/os-quota-sets
>
> Status in OpenStack Compute (Nova):
>  Invalid
> Status in OpenStack QA:
>  New
>
> Bug description:
>  I can not get tenant quota from /{version}/{tenantID}/os-quota-sets
>  However, I can get it from /{version}/{tenantID}/os-quota-sets/{tenantID}.
>
> To manage notifications about this bug go to:
> https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/899298/+subscriptions
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~nati-ueno

comments.content: I agree it's redundant, but that doesn't mean we have a bug. In the case that an admin is using the extension, the request can actually have a different tenant_id. We can redesign the extension when we add it to the core spec.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~bcwaldon

comments.content:
Thanks Brian
I got it.
